intro: Schoenus graminifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedgeland grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are usually narrow and pointed, with a smooth texture. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Schoenus graminifolius plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
